title: Stereo Image Coding for Machines with Joint Visual Feature Compression
author: Dengchao Jin (Tianjin University), Jianjun Lei (Tianjin University), Bo Peng (Tianjin University), Zhaoqing Pan (Tianjin University), Nam Ling (Santa Clara University), Qingming Huang (University of Chinese Academy of Sciences)
background: The study focuses on the efficient compression of stereo images for machine vision applications, aiming to improve visual task performance while managing bitrate constraints.
contribution: This paper introduces a Machine Vision-Oriented Stereo Feature Compression Network (MVSFC-Net) to solve the challenge of stereo image compression for machines, achieving superior compression efficiency and improved performance on 3D visual tasks.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous stereo image coding methods primarily targeted human visual systems and often focus on pixel-level fidelity, which may not adequately serve machine perception tasks.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves upon traditional methods by emphasizing high-level semantic fidelity and efficiently compressing visual features rather than pixel data, allowing better task performance under bandwidth constraints.

key_innovation: Introduces a stereo multi-scale feature compression module that progressively reduces redundancy across spatial, inter-view, and cross-scale dimensions.
real_world_impact: Improvements in stereo image coding could enhance applications in areas like autonomous driving and smart cities, where efficient 3D visual analysis is crucial.

new_terms.Stereo Image Coding: **Stereo Image Coding** refers to techniques developed for efficiently compressing two images captured from slightly different viewpoints to create a stereo effect.
new_terms.MVSFC-Net: **Machine Vision-Oriented Stereo Feature Compression Network (MVSFC-Net)** is a specialized neural network designed for compressing stereo images with a focus on machine vision applications.
